title: Dare to Stop Putin or Offer Him a Way Out?
sub_head: After inviting Russia to invade Ukraine, now comes the tough part.
body:
William Galston concludes “Our Moral Obligation to Ukraine” (Politics & Ideas, March 16) by saying that “we should be able to tell ourselves that we did everything that could reasonably be expected of us, short of risking war with a nuclear-armed aggressor, to prevent this outcome.”
Actually, we all but invited Vladimir Putin to invade. Our chaotic Afghanistan withdrawal, meaningless red lines, tolerance of the Crimea land grab and advertising that we wouldn’t involve ourselves in the defense of Ukraine made the overrun of that country appear a risk-free proposition.
